fullText: Grey House is a horror play that works best when it leans into its B-movie sensibilities and stops trying to be something more profound than it is.
dtliExcerpt: Grey House is a horror play that works best when it leans into its B-movie sensibilities and stops trying to be something more profound than it is.
showScoreExcerpt: Grey House is a horror play that works best when it leans into its B-movie sensibilities and stops trying to be something more profound than it is.

llmScore.reasoning: [ensemble-unanimous] | All 3 models agree: Mixed | Claude: The review suggests the show has merit when it embraces its horror/B-movie nature but implies it fails when attempting deeper meaning, indicating mixed results rather than a clear recommendation. | GPT-4o: The review suggests that the play has strengths when it embraces its genre but implies shortcomings when it attempts to be more profound, indicating a mixed reception. | Gemini: The review suggests the play has positive aspects when it embraces its B-movie nature, but also implies it falters when it aims for deeper meaning, resulting in a mixed assessment.
